name: test-driven-development
description: Write tests first, then implement code to pass tests
key_steps: 1. Write a failing test for the desired behavior
2. Run test to confirm it fails
3. Write minimal code to pass the test
4. Run test to confirm it passes
5. Refactor if needed while keeping tests green

name: systematic-debugging
description: Debug issues using systematic search and isolation
key_steps: 2. Read error messages and stack traces carefully
3. Use Grep to find relevant code locations
4. Add logging or console output to trace execution
5. Isolate the problem to smallest failing case

name: safe-refactoring
description: Refactor code safely with test coverage
prerequisites: tests exist or can be written first
key_steps: 1. Ensure tests exist for code to refactor

name: api-endpoint-creation
description: Create a new REST API endpoint with validation and error handling

name: typescript-type-errors
key_steps: 1. Run tsc --noEmit to get all errors
2. Fix errors in dependency order (imports first)
3. Use explicit types when inference fails
5. Re-run type check after each batch
